instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) No image
threads.message: Hi the board start and chime ,the backlight output give 49V on pin 1 Lvsd but no image no backlight ,try 2 different screens still same ,PP_vcore is 1.8V ,Lcd connector looks fine no corrosion or damage,I also getting 5V on L8300

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) No image
threads.message:
49V means no load on the backlight. There must be an image else there would be no 49V and 5V on L8300. Hold a flashlight to the apple logo.
Measure continuity from pin 1 to the end of a separate LCD cable, I bet the connector is fucked.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) No image
threads.message: Its very strange situation again ,replace screen and works ok,I put that same screen in another macbook working perfect .Just to say that all same models A1502 just one is from 2013,second 2014 whats the difference

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) No image
threads.message: 2013/14 are the same. 2015 with force click trackpad is the model that is different.
